geometry.planar

Interface ConvexShape

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Area, Shape
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle, IntBox, IntOctagon, RegularTileShape, Simplex, TileShape

    public interface ConvexShape
extends Shape
    A shape is defined as convex, if for each line segment with both endpoints contained in the shape the whole segment is contained completely in the shape.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double max_width()
      Returns the maximum diameter of the shape.
      double min_width()
      Returns the minimum diameter of the shape.
      ConvexShape offset(double p_distance)
      Calculates the offset shape by p_distance.
      ConvexShape shrink(double p_offset)
      Shrinks the shape by p_offset.

        area, border_distance, bounding_shape, bounding_tile, centre_of_gravity, circumference, contains_inside, contains_on_border, cutout, distance, enlarge, intersects, intersects, intersects, intersects, intersects, is_outside, smallest_radius

      • Methods inherited from interface geometry.planar.Area

    • Method Detail

      • offset

        ConvexShape offset(double p_distance)
        Calculates the offset shape by p_distance. If p_distance > 0, the shape will be enlarged, else the result shape will be smaller.
        Parameters:
        p_distance - a double.
        Returns:
        a ConvexShape object.

      • shrink

        ConvexShape shrink(double p_offset)
        Shrinks the shape by p_offset. The result shape will not be empty.
        Parameters:
        p_offset - a double.
        Returns:
        a ConvexShape object.

      • max_width

        double max_width()
        Returns the maximum diameter of the shape.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • min_width

        double min_width()
        Returns the minimum diameter of the shape.
        Returns:
        a double.
